issue.title: Additional eye mount assorted troubles
issue.body: Additional eye mount should be able to accept a (presumably?) essence free cyber eye. Currently you can place additional eye mounts in limbs ect or in meat as one would expect but there is no way to associate a cybereye to it, nor any way to add an essence free eye to the mount.

comment.body:
At a certain point, we might just start asking ourselves if the best way to resolve this issue is to just create an amends that implements reasonable house rules.

Chummer by default likes to stick with RAW as close as possible, while presenting options that allow to to be adapted to house rules. By pushing the fix for this issue as an amends, we don't have to worry about RAW deviations and could even do seemingly reasonable things like "Just give people a free 'single cybereye' and charge them for the upgrades" or "Charge people 50% of the cost of a cybereyes basic system and maybe has 50% the capacity to buy the actual eye". Or we could just charge full price for the cybereyes and yeah you only get one that's capitalism for ya.


We do have to keep in mind the fact that the most important part of the Cybereyes is the rating, which determines their capacity. There is an awful lot of missing rules in place, so I think this makes sense to implement as an amends file, rather than a core change to the default chummer.

issue.title: Chummer hangs when Nuyen Rewards or Expenditures are manually added to a character sheet
issue.body:
If you try to add nuyen rewards or expenditures to a character sheet manually, Chummer v5.225.327 and v5.225.321 do not update your character's current nuyen figure with the addition or expenditure and seem to process the change for a long period of time with no actual changes.

If you attempt to save the character sheet in this state, the nuyen figure is saved incorrectly, as even though the expenditure or reward entry is saved, the expenditure or reward is not subtracted from or added to the character's available nuyen.

issue.title: [Feature Request] Export non-number values also in english
issue.body:
Some values are not exported in field_english, e.g.

- range of spells
- type of spells
- damage of spells
- dv of spells
- if a spell is direct or indirect

commits.message: Fixed Various Minor Issues with Reader-Writer Locking

issue.title: Program Unpredictably Locks Up when Opening a Character

labels.name: Showstopper
labels.description: An issue that *must* be fixed before the next milestone release

issue.body:
When opening a character, either an existing one or a newly created one, Chummer will sometimes lock up and refuse to load. The problem is extremely frustrating because of how unpredictable it is. The unit test for loading in character UIs will sometimes lock up and fail as a result, but not always, so builds will still sometimes get published regardless.

As far as I can tell from turning on the debug flag that saves stack traces when `DebuggableSemaphoreSlim` gets set, the lock up happens because of a `RegisterOneWayAsyncDataBindingAsync` call that sets a write lock for a character (when adding something to said character's `OnPropertyChanged`) and then refuses to release it, causing a property getter for said character to be unable to get some value needed for the UI and spin until the emergency exit code forces the program to crash. Alternatively, we have some kind of circular lock scenario where a read lock is waiting for the write lock to complete while the write lock is waiting for the read lock to complete, but there does not seem to be the multiple parallel tasks present that should cause this to happen (and besides, the reader semaphore is only set for read locks after they have already gone through dealing with the write-lock-semaphore, so this circular situation should be impossible).

comment.body:
I have tracked the source of this issue down to the way writer locks interact with non-upgradeable reader locks.

In order to increase performance, reader locks don't interact with the `AsyncLocal` information used to track the number of times a read lock has been acquired in the current `ExecutionContext`. Instead, reader locks simply check to see if the writer lock is held and then increment the global reader lock count and set the reader semaphore as necessary, acquiring the current writer lock to do so only if there is any writer lock currently being held.

Writer locks, in turn, are acquired in a way to make sure they are not only exclusive with other writer lock acquisitions, but also to make sure that they get priority over read locks. When a writer lock is attempted to be acquired, it will first wait to (safely) set the current writer lock semaphore (which can change depending on `ExecutionContext` to allow re-entrant writer locks to work). Once it has set the semaphore, if it is the first writer lock in the `ExecutionContext`, it will wait for other reader locks to exit before continuing. This means waiting to acquire and then immediately release the reader lock semaphore if the acquisition is not inside an upgradeable reader lock and spinning until the global active readers count is equal to the local active readers count if it is inside an upgradeable reader lock (which would only unset the reader lock semaphore after it has exited).

This setup creates two major possibilities of conflict, one of which ends up causing this issue:
1. A writer lock is acquired, inside which (re-entrancy!) a reader lock and a separate writer lock are acquired. The re-entrant writer lock should spin to wait for the re-entrant reader lock to finish, but it won't because it thinks it doesn't need to because it is already preventing conflicting reader locks by not being the first time a writer lock has been acquired in the `ExecutionContext`.
2. A reader lock is acquired, then a separate writer lock is acquired, then a reader lock re-entrant within the first reader lock is acquired. The first reader lock sets the reader lock semaphore when it was acquired, but does not do anything with the writer lock semaphore besides check it if it was set. The first writer lock immediately sets the top-level writer lock semaphore (as intended, for reasons stated before), sees that it is the first writer lock in the `ExecutionContext`, and so waits for the first reader lock to exit (the method of which depends on if there's an upgradeable read lock enclosing it, but is irrelevant for this problem). The re-entrant read lock sees that the writer lock semaphore is set and so waits to acquire briefly acquire it and then release it. This is supposed to happen as part of the way writer locks are supposed to be prioritized over reader locks, but causes a deadlock in this situation: the writer lock has set the writer semaphore and is waiting for the existing read lock to release, but the existing read lock cannot release until it is able to set the writer semaphore.


Problem 1 is more niche, but can be fixed relatively easily by having writer locks always wait for active readers to finish instead of only if they're the top one (and tweaking some other stuff in the code to make this work). Problem 2 is what is causing this issue.

issue.title: Chummer crashes if I open a character for export and language is German
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
If I try to open a character for export and the language of Chummer is set to German, Chummer crashes. It does not show any error message. it just "disappears". I can export all my characers if I set the language of Chummer to English. I can even export them with a German character sheet as long as the language of Chummer itself is English.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Switch the language of Chummer to German. Note that exporting the Character with a German sheet does not trigger the crash when the language of Chummer itself is English.
![Screenshot 2023-10-24 161844](https://github.com/chummer5a/chummer5a/assets/36237757/d16cfc75-2ca6-4e84-ad95-7e7cf7c231bb)
2. Restart Chummer
3. Open the attached character for export

**Expected behavior**
It would show the JSON character data.

**Character File**
[TNT_export.txt](https://github.com/chummer5a/chummer5a/files/13116928/TNT_export.txt)


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - Windows 10
 - Version 5.225.322

![Screenshot 2023-10-24 162034](https://github.com/chummer5a/chummer5a/assets/36237757/a9cd80e9-4a88-4d37-94d6-f598d17aadde)

I would expect that it mark the Qi-Focus as bound and apply the bonus to the Automatics skill.


**Character File**

[TNT_export.txt](https://github.com/chummer5a/chummer5a/files/13116684/TNT_export.txt)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - Windows 10
 - Version e.g. 5.225.322

**Additional context**
It seems to depend on the language setting of Chummer. If I set language to English it works. It crashes if I set language to German

issue.title: Additional eye mount assorted troubles
issue.body: Additional eye mount should be able to accept a (presumably?) essence free cyber eye. Currently you can place additional eye mounts in limbs ect or in meat as one would expect but there is no way to associate a cybereye to it, nor any way to add an essence free eye to the mount.

comment.body: Yea I would think that is the way to go tbh. Imthough it some someplace that basic cybereyes come I. Pairs even if you install just 1 it's still costs the same so I'd just make a eye basic system that can go in the socket a d accepts the normal eye stuff.  It probably shouldn't doable natural eye abilities though since the eye isbt getting replaced in this case.

issue.title: Additional eye mount assorted troubles
issue.body: Additional eye mount should be able to accept a (presumably?) essence free cyber eye. Currently you can place additional eye mounts in limbs ect or in meat as one would expect but there is no way to associate a cybereye to it, nor any way to add an essence free eye to the mount.

comment.body:
At this point I'd argue just allowing buying the CRB Cybereyes Basic system as a plugin for the Additional eye Mount.

It's not a perfect solution, but it's the only solution we got that uses RAW stats. 


People can technically adjust the cost themselves if they like by saying "I should only pay half the price" and there is an option to pay a percentage of the price. But current Chummer behavior does not even support the option of picking up the additional eye.

issue.title: Can not Buy Additional eye for the Additional Eye Mount
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Attempting to add Cybereyes to the Additional eye Mount just plain doesn't work, and instead produces an error saying we need to select a piece of cyberware.

**Screenshots**
![image-1](https://github.com/chummer5a/chummer5a/assets/1766631/3f6fd77c-e41e-4d20-9155-d5ee8fa22c7e)

![image](https://github.com/chummer5a/chummer5a/assets/1766631/bb37ffea-261c-4d77-9b57-01c882821a39)

![Screenshot 2023-10-22 at 12 04 44 AM](https://github.com/chummer5a/chummer5a/assets/1766631/ded67404-2e95-456c-8914-a022bd553f92)


**Additional context**
This feels like a fairly easy XML issue, I can look into it later this week.

comment.body: Was looking over other issues and I'm closing this as a duplicate of #5028

issue.title: Enable buying PACKS post chargen
issue.body: Basically, I'd like to request a feature that allows a character to turn around and buy a PACKS kit post chargen. Post chargen would need to disable some functions, such as "spend karma for nuyen" as that doesn't apply in chargen, but this would allow characters, especially those who had to recently burn a lifestyle and lose a lot of gear, the ability to mass-buy basic gear again.

comment.body: I'd say make an expense for each added item. Just a shortcut method for buying multiple things at once. Would also let people play with it a little by undoing some expenses.

issue.title: Program Unpredictably Locks Up when Opening a Character

labels.name: Showstopper
labels.description: An issue that *must* be fixed before the next milestone release

issue.body:
When opening a character, either an existing one or a newly created one, Chummer will sometimes lock up and refuse to load. The problem is extremely frustrating because of how unpredictable it is. The unit test for loading in character UIs will sometimes lock up and fail as a result, but not always, so builds will still sometimes get published regardless.

As far as I can tell from turning on the debug flag that saves stack traces when `DebuggableSemaphoreSlim` gets set, the lock up happens because of a `RegisterOneWayAsyncDataBindingAsync` call that sets a write lock for a character (when adding something to said character's `OnPropertyChanged`) and then refuses to release it, causing a property getter for said character to be unable to get some value needed for the UI and spin until the emergency exit code forces the program to crash. Alternatively, we have some kind of circular lock scenario where a read lock is waiting for the write lock to complete while the write lock is waiting for the read lock to complete, but there does not seem to be the multiple parallel tasks present that should cause this to happen (and besides, the reader semaphore is only set for read locks after they have already gone through dealing with the write-lock-semaphore, so this circular situation should be impossible).

Some values are not exported in field_english, e.g.

commits.message: Fixed all cybersuites being treated as cyberlimbs

Merge pull request #5059 from JoschiZ/fix-cybersuites-not-applying

Fixed all cybersuites being treated as cyberlimbs

pull_request.title: Fixed all cybersuites being treated as cyberlimbs
pull_request.body: Removed a remnant of the first iteration of #5055

commits.message:
Switched to Distinguishing Upgradeable vs. Non-Upgradeable Read Locks

This should require us to mess with the number of active reader locks a lot less.
Cleaned Up Some Issues around Hacky AsyncLocal Handling
Fixed Up Some Bad Instances of Write Locks within Read Locks
